ai.summary: A very short, easy hike along the Equestrian Route Seafield in the UK. At about 0.4 km, this gentle route is suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a quick, low-effort outing. The path may be shared with horses and riders.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat, surfaced path with occasional grass verges. Some sections can be muddy after rain. The route is shared with horses, riders, and possibly cyclists; watch footing near gates and when approaching horse users.
ai.safety_notes: Yield to horses and riders; pass slowly and with caution. Keep dogs under control or on a leash where required. Wear sturdy footwear and be mindful of uneven ground and mud after rain. Carry a small light if visibility is low and always stay on the designated path.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or light boots
Sunscreen and hat in sunny weather
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn; winter may be muddy and summer can be exposed.
